definition: certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: You'll have to go and ask the vicar if he'll marry you in church.
sentences.chinese: 你得去问一问牧师看是否愿意为你在教堂内证婚。

sentences.english: The civil marriage also requires the presences to two witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 民事婚姻也要求两个证婚人在场。

sentences.english: She was married by a man ten years younger.
sentences.chinese: 是指为她证婚的牧师，比她小十岁。

sentences.english: But Valentine would secretly marry young men that came to him.
sentences.chinese: 但是瓦伦廷秘密地为找上门的年轻人证婚。

sentences.english: They were married by a bishop.
The registrar said she'd never seen such a happy wedding.
sentences.chinese: 证婚人说，她从未见过如此开心的婚礼。

sentences.english: Eastern Europe witnesses the ceremony hall classic, elegant and dignified.
sentences.chinese: 东欧经典婚礼殿堂证婚仪式，优雅而庄重。
一位老朋友为他们证婚。

sentences.english: At their wedding ceremony, the old bureau chief was their chief witness.
sentences.chinese: 在他们的结婚仪式上，由老所长给他俩做证婚人。

definition: attendant of the bride or bridegroom at a wedding
to worship heaven and earth/ritual kneeling by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/also called 拜堂
ritual kneeling to heaven and earth by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/same as 拜天地
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
to offer birthday congratulations (to an elderly person)
to cut the ribbon (at a launching or opening ceremony)
